Perceptor/DarkHawk:

Darkhawk drag Tucson and attach him toa torture device=
, as soon as they caught the RAt the they will have their sport.  Percpetor=
 Was clsoe to Rattrap, be blind had their advantage and he heard a tiny ste=
ps close to him; with out hesitation he opened fire agaisnt Ratrap as well =
as the base Defences 


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, February 23, 2010 11:46=
 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortre=
ss


  
Tucson had no energy left to fight back. He could hardly feel Dark =
Hawk pounding on him, as he now goes off line and offers no resistance to h=
is enemy's wrath. Not one sound from him as this happens. He lands on his s=
ide, and remains still. His only hope now was that Rat Trap could get to th=
e Ark. 

Trying to get away from the internal defenses proves difficult to =
Rat Trap. With the droids hot on his tail literally, he struggles to scampe=
r out of his predicament.

" This is it, I'm a dead rat! I'm a dead rat! I'=
M A DEAD RAT! GAHHHH!!!"

Out of sheer panic he slides into a slip hole int=
o a vent shaft. It proves dark and tight, just big enough for a rat to fit =
in. He stays there to catch his breath.

" Sorry Wheels... I ran into a maj=
or set back.. Maaaaan talk about a mouse trap." 

The transmitter given to =
him, begins to pulse. Just a slight faster than before. Yet still very far =
away from his destination, Rat Trap looks to it, and listens to it.

" The =
transmitter.. It's - got somethn'. Kinda faint but a little bit faster than=
 before.. Which way now?"

With so many droids roaming the halls, it would =
prove impossible for Rat Trap to continue his journey unseen. He thinks to =
himself.

" If I sit here I ain't never gonna get ta the Ark. And if I don'=
t get ta the ark, those preds'n cons are gonna exploit it for their own per=
sonal gain. And it looks like Tucson's the key ta gettn' what they want. No=
, I can't just sit here, he's count'n on me. Dead rat or no dead Rat, I got=
ta do this."

Slowly and cautiously he ventures out of his hole.

--- In nb=
wrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Hydras/Perceptor/Darkhawk
=
> 
> 
> Hydras was furious and yelled by the "I WANT THOSE INTRUDERS AND IF=
 ONE OF THEM RUNS YOU WIL SUFFER MY WRATh!!!!"
> 
> The internal defences t=
urn on and Opened fire against RAttrap, a wounded but still fuctional Darkh=
awk kicked badly Tucson and after a hard beating he attemped to tied ightly=
 tied his arms and legs. 
> 
> Perceptor looking to Rodimus said "Go and le=
arn what Zarak is into... after that Report to hdyras what is happening as =
well as our own plans, I need to do a trip and find the Ark before the mous=
e arrives" and opening a channel he said "Scourge, I need your help... we a=
re in a mission: Mouse open season... go to my location"
> 
> Perceptor ran=
 towards the poitn where Ratrap was 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Tuesday, =
February 23, 2010 9:48 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Reco=
vering Rodimus/BlackFortress
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson reels in pain, and then real=
izes that Nightlight is not responding to his call. She was unconcious. Aga=
in, with every effort he tries to make, his actions once again put a major =
strain on his systems as his energy levels drop from sixty to forty percent=
. This wouldn't bode well for him. He could no longer transform, he could n=
o longer move without great effort. He collapses to the ground, and now hea=
ring Scorponok's steps, he remains up against a wall, burnt out, nearly bro=
ken, and severely drained of his resources. His shinny silver armor scuffed=
 and dented, appearing like something out of a major car wreck. He could no=
t go any further. !!
> 
> Rat Trap stands over him and stays by his side.
>=
 
> "Wheels, no, ya can't give up on me, not like this."
> 
> Tucson puts h=
is hand with effort into Rat Traps'.
> 
> "I - may not be - able to move, b=
ut, you - still have all your energy reserves - in tact. Rat - Trap. I - ne=
ed you to - f- find the others, Zarak mentoned the Ark.. You - must find it=
 and - try to get help. Can - you do that?"
> 
> Rat Trap nodds.
> 
> " I h=
ate leavn' ya here Wheels, but we're outa options. Okay, I'll do it. For yo=
u I'll risk my aft. But, how do I find it? When will I know I've reached it=
?"
> 
> Tucson gasps for breath. He then takes off his transmitter from his=
 helmet and turns on a beacon. The beacon pulses slowly on it. 
> 
> " Ther=
e is a beacon on this transmitter. The faster it - pulsates, the closser yo=
u - are to finding the Ark. It was installed on my helmet after I became vi=
sually impaired, so I could find my way back to the Ark after - each missio=
n. The beacon reacts to the alloys used to build the ship. And only ones us=
ed by Autobots. 
> 
> Rat Trap takes the transmitter.
> 
> "But without thi=
s you're a sittn' duck. This is our ears, this is how you navigate. Without=
 this, you'll be bumpn' the walls constantly."
> 
> Tucson sighs.
> 
> " I =
can't go anywhere anyway. Now, get - going. You have a lot of ground to cov=
er."
> 
> Rat Trap nodds, while Tucson secures the transmitter onto his lef=
t ear, while in his rat form. The transmitter seems rather large for his ea=
r yet, he carries it sufficiantly.
> 
> " You can count on me Wheels."
> 
>=
 He leaves his disabled friend, and darts out into the hallways in his rat =
form, cautiously moving and freezing in place once in open areas. The trans=
mitter blips slowly. He still had a long way to go before he could reach th=
e Ark.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@>=
 wrote:

eading on

rm of a

uscon

it only took seconds! Rat Trap appeared, Tuscon
> > revived, Darkhawk was k=
nocked down, and for a moment it seemed as if
> > Tuscon was going to drive=
 right over him, but then he swerved, and
> > after a blast from Rat Trap t=
hat blasted open a section of wall they
> > took off down.
> > 
> > Zarak s=
miled as he sent a few shots from his energy rifle down after
> > the fleei=
ng Autobot and Maximal!
> > 
> > Quickly he leaped over to where the fallen=
 Darkhawk lay as he opened a
> > communication to Hydras and Perceptor, "Th=
e prisoner has escaped!"
> > Zarak looked back over at the hole that was bl=
own in the door as he
> > spoke, "There were two of them. One of them was h=
iding on that Tuscon
> > Autobot. He somehow freed him and they're driving =
through the base!"
> > 
> > Even as Zarak did quick scan of Darkhawk to che=
ck his vitals, a deep
> > thunk of metal boots hitting thick deck plating c=
ould be heard from
> > behind him. A door slid open.
> > 
> > After ascerta=
ining that Darkhawk would live he stood and turned, "Yes
> > my old friend,=
 the time has come once again."
> > 
> > Taking up the entire frame of the =
door was the massive figure of
> > Scorponok, Zarak's second body so to spe=
ak. At the moment it was
> > headless, giving it a strangely ghastly and ye=
t vulnerable appearance.
> > However that was easily rectified as Zarak lea=
ped into the air and
> > with the tel-tale sounds of gears grinding he shif=
ted into a head, one
> > that slipped perfectly between Scorponok's shoulde=
rs and clicked.
> > 
> > In his own form Zarak was short, even diminutive, =
but now joined once
> > again with Scorponok he was fully head and shoulder=
s taller then most
> > Maximals and Predicons! With a Decepticon purple fra=
me and powerfully
> > built green limbs he radiated aggression and domminan=
ce! The cannons
> > mounted on his shoulders and the massive claws that he =
had for hands
> > were mute testimony to the true destructive potential tha=
t lay at his
> > command.
> > 
> > He transformed into his destructive crab=
 mode and took off after Rat
> > Trap and Tuscon!
> > 
> > OOC: I think tha=
t Cyclonus and Scourge and the rest are somewhat
> > separate from all this=
 for them not to be involved, so I will post for
> > them in a different le=
tter.
> > 
> > Preston
